entry.name: Patient's Name
entry.description: Patient's full name.

entry.name: Patient ID
entry.description: Primary hospital identification number or code for the patient.

entry.name: Issuer of Patient ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Patient ID.

entry.name: Patient's Birth Date
entry.description: Birth date of the patient.

entry.name: Patient's Sex
entry.description: Sex of the named patient. Enumerated Values: M = male F = female O = other

entry.name: Referenced Patient Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides reference to a Patient SOP Class/Instance pair. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Patient Sequence (0008,1120) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Patient Sequence (0008,1120) is sent.

entry.name: Patient's Birth Time
entry.description: Birth time of the Patient.

entry.name: Other Patient IDs
entry.description: Other identification numbers or codes used to identify the patient.

entry.name: Other Patient IDs Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of identification numbers or codes used to identify the patient, which may or may not be human readable, and may or may not have been obtained from an implanted or attached device such as an RFID or barcode. If present, shall contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Patient ID
entry.description: An identification number or code used to identify the patient.

entry.name: >Issuer of Patient ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Patient ID.

entry.name: >Type of Patient ID
entry.description: The type of identifier in this item. Defined Terms: TEXT RFID BARCODE Note: The identifier is coded as a string regardless of the type, not as a binary value.

entry.name: Other Patient Names
entry.description: Other names used to identify the patient.

entry.name: Ethnic Group
entry.description: Ethnic group or race of the patient.

entry.name: Patient Comments
entry.description: User-defined additional information about the patient.

entry.name: Patient Species Description
entry.description: The species of the patient. Required if the patient is an animal and if Patient Species Code Sequence (0010,2202) is not present. May be present otherwise.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 7454.

entry.name: Patient Species Code Sequence
entry.description: The species of the patient. One Item shall be present. Required if the patient is an animal and if Patient Species Description (0010,2201) is not present. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Patient Breed Description
entry.description: The breed of the patient. Required if the patient is an animal and if Patient Breed Code Sequence (0010,2293) is empty. May be present otherwise.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 7480.

entry.name: Patient Breed Code Sequence
entry.description: The breed of the patient. Zero or more Items shall be present. Required if the patient is an animal.

entry.name: Breed Registration Sequence
entry.description: Information identifying an animal within a breed registry. Zero or more Items shall be present. Required if the patient is an animal.

entry.name: >Breed Registration Number
entry.description: Identification number of an animal within the registry.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 7481.

entry.name: >Breed Registry Code Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the organization with which an animal is registered. One Item shall be present.

entry.name: Responsible Person
entry.description: Name of person with medical decision making authority for the patient. Required if the patient is an animal. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Responsible Person Role
entry.description: Relationship of Responsible Person to the patient. Defined Terms: OWNER Required if Responsible Person is present and has a value.

entry.name: Responsible Organization
entry.description: Name of organization with medical decision making authority for the patient. Required if patient is an animal. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Patient Identity Removed
entry.description: The true identity of the patient has been removed from the Attributes and the Pixel Data Enumerated Values: YES NO

entry.name: De-identification Method
entry.description: A description or label of the mechanism or method use to remove the patient's identity. May be multi-valued if successive de-identification steps have been performed. Note: This may be used to describe the extent or thoroughness of the de- identification, for example whether or not the de-identification is for a "Limited Data Set" (as per HIPAA Privacy Rule). Required if Patient Identity Removed (0012,0062) is present and has a value of YES and De-identification Method Code Sequence (0012,0064) is not present.

include.ref: >Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: De-identification Method Code Sequence
entry.description: A code describing the mechanism or method use to remove the patient's identity. One or more Items shall be present. Multiple items are used if successive de-identification steps have been performed Required if Patient Identity Removed (0012,0062) is present and has a value of YES and De-identification Method (0012,0063) is not present.

entry.name: Specimen Accession Number
entry.description: A departmental Information System identifier that identifies the Accession. See Section C.7.1.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Specimen Sequence
entry.description: Detailed description of one or more specimens. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Specimen Identifier
entry.description: A departmental information system identifier for the Specimen. See Section C.7.1.2.1.2 for further explanation. Required if a sequence item is present.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context IDs are defined

entry.name: >Specimen Type Code Sequence
entry.description: Specimen Type. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence. Required if a sequence item is present and Specimen Identifier (0040,0551) is sent.

entry.name: >Slide Identifier
entry.description: Identifier of the Slide. Required if a sequence item is present and the Specimen is a Slide.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Sponsor Name
entry.description: The name of the clinical trial sponsor. See C.7.1.3.1.1.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Protocol ID
entry.description: Identifier for the noted protocol. See C.7.1.3.1.2.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Protocol Name
entry.description: The name of the clinical trial protocol. See C.7.1.3.1.3.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Site ID
entry.description: The identifier of the site responsible for submitting clinical trial data. See C.7.1.3.1.4.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Site Name
entry.description: Name of the site responsible for submitting clinical trial data. See C.7.1.3.1.5

entry.name: Clinical Trial Subject ID
entry.description: The assigned identifier for the clinical trial subject. See C.7.1.3.1.6. Shall be present if Clinical Trial Subject Reading ID (0012,0042) is absent. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Subject Reading ID
entry.description: Identifies the subject for blinded evaluations. Shall be present if Clinical Trial Subject ID (0012,0040) is absent. May be present otherwise. See C.7.1.3.1.7.

entry.name: Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study.

entry.name: Study Date
entry.description: Date the Study started.

entry.name: Study Time
entry.description: Time the Study started.

entry.name: Referring Physician's Name
entry.description: Name of the patient's referring physician

include.ref: >Include `Person Identification Macro' Table 10-1

entry.name: Referring Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the patient's referring physician. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Study ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated Study identifier.

entry.name: Accession Number
entry.description: A RIS generated number that identifies the order for the Study.

entry.name: Study Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Study (component) performed.

entry.name: Physician(s) of Record
entry.description: Names of the physician(s) who are responsible for overall patient care at time of Study (see Section C.7.3.1 for Performing Physician)

include.ref: >Include `Person Identification Macro' Table 10-1

entry.name: Physician(s) of Record Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physician(s) who are responsible for overall patient care at time of Study. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Physician(s) of Record (0008,1048), if present.

entry.name: Name of Physician(s) Reading Study
entry.description: Names of the physician(s) reading the Study.

include.ref: >Include `Person Identification Macro' Table 10-1

entry.name: Physician(s) Reading Study Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physician(s) reading the Study. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Name of Physician(s) Reading Study (0008,1060), if present.

entry.name: Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that provides reference to a Study SOP Class/Instance pair. The sequence may have zero or more Items.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Study Sequence (0008,1110) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Study Sequence (0008,1110) is sent.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that conveys the type of procedure performed. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: Admitting Diagnoses Description
entry.description: Description of the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses)

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Admitting Diagnoses Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses). One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: Patient's Age
entry.description: Age of the Patient.

entry.name: Patient's Size
entry.description: Length or size of the Patient, in meters.

entry.name: Patient's Weight
entry.description: Weight of the Patient, in kilograms.

entry.name: Occupation
entry.description: Occupation of the Patient.

entry.name: Additional Patient's History
entry.description: Additional information about the Patient's medical history.

entry.name: Admission ID
entry.description: Identification number of the visit as assigned by the healthcare provider

entry.name: Issuer of Admission ID
entry.description: Name of healthcare provider that issued the Admission ID

entry.name: Patient's Sex Neutered
entry.description: Whether or not a procedure has been performed in an effort to render the patient sterile. Enumerated value: ALTERED = Altered/Neutered UNALTERED = Unaltered/intact Note: If this Attribute is present but has no value then the status is unknown. Required if patient is an animal. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Time Point ID
entry.description: An identifier specifying the one or more studies that are grouped together as a clinical time point or submission in a clinical trial. See C.7.2.3.1.1.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Time Point Description
entry.description: A description of a set of one or more studies that are grouped together to represent a clinical time point or submission in a clinical trial. See C.7.2.3.1.1.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images in this Series. See C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms.

entry.name: Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series.

entry.name: Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Series.

entry.name: Laterality
entry.description: Laterality of (paired) body part examined. Required if the body part examined is a paired structure and Image Laterality (0020,0062) or Frame Laterality (0020,9072) are not sent. Enumerated Values: R = right L = left Note: Some IODs support Image Laterality (0020,0062) at the Image level or Frame Laterality(0020,9072) at the Frame level in the Frame Anatomy functional group macro, which can provide a more comprehensive mechanism for specifying the laterality of the body part(s) being examined.

entry.name: Series Date
entry.description: Date the Series started.

entry.name: Series Time
entry.description: Time the Series started.

entry.name: Performing Physicians' Name
entry.description: Name of the physician(s) administering the Series.

include.ref: >Include `Person Identification Macro' Table 10-1

entry.name: Performing Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physician(s) administering the Series. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Performing Physicians' Name (0008,1050), if present.

entry.name: Protocol Name
entry.description: User-defined description of the conditions under which the Series was performed. Note: This attribute conveys series-specific protocol identification and may or may not be identical to the one presented in the Performed Protocol Code Sequence (0040,0260).

entry.name: Series Description
entry.description: User provided description of the Series

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name(s) of the operator(s) supporting the Series.

include.ref: >Include `Person Identification Macro' Table 10-1

entry.name: Operator Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the operator(s) supporting the Series. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Operators' Name (0008,1070), if present.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related (e.g. a Modality or General-Purpose Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance). The Sequence shall have zero or one Item.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance. Required if Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence (0008,1111) is sent.

entry.name: Related Series Sequence
entry.description: Identification of Series significantly related to this Series. Zero or more Items may be present. Notes: 1. For example, for a combined CT and PET acquisition, the CT images and PET images would be in separate series that could cross- reference each other with multiple purpose of reference codes meaning same anatomy, simultaneously acquired and same indication. 2. The related series may have different Frames of Reference and hence require some sort of registration before spatial coordinates can be directly compared. 3. This attribute is not intended for conveying localizer reference information, for which Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140) should be used.

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Instance UID of Study to which the related Series belongs

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Instance UID of Related Series

include.ref: >>Include Code Sequence Macro Table 8.8-1 DCID 7210

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Zero or more Items may be present. When absent, implies that the reason for the reference is unknown.

entry.name: Body Part Examined
entry.description: Text description of the part of the body examined. Defined Terms: SKULL, CSPINE, TSPINE, LSPINE, SSPINE, COCCYX, CHEST, CLAVICLE, BREAST, ABDOMEN, PELVIS, HIP, SHOULDER, ELBOW, KNEE, ANKLE, HAND, FOOT, EXTREMITY, HEAD, HEART, NECK, LEG, ARM, JAW Note: Some IODs support the Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218), which can provide a more comprehensive mechanism for specifying the body part being examined.

entry.name: Patient Position
entry.description: Patient position descriptor relative to the equipment. Required for CT and MR images; shall not be present if Patient Orientation Code Sequence (0054,0410) is present; may be present otherwise. See C.7.3.1.1.2 for Defined Terms and further explanation.

entry.name: Smallest Pixel Value in Series
entry.description: The minimum value of all images in this Series.

entry.name: Largest Pixel Value in Series
entry.description: The maximum value of all images in this Series.

include.ref: >Include Request Attributes Macro Table 10-9 No Baseline Context IDs defined

entry.name: Request Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that contains attributes from the Imaging Service Request. The sequence may have one or more Items.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated identifier of that part of a Procedure that has been carried out within this step.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Date
entry.description: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Time
entry.description: Time on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Procedure Step that was performed.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for this Procedure Step. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Content Item Macro' Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>>Include `Content Item Macro' Table 10-2 No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.

entry.name: Comments on the Performed Procedure Step
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Performed Procedure Step.

entry.name: Clinical Trial Coordinating Center Name
entry.description: The name of the institution that is responsible for coordinating the medical imaging data for the clinical trial. See C.7.3.2.1.1.

entry.name: Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the frame of reference for a Series. See C.7.4.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Position Reference Indicator
entry.description: Part of the patient's anatomy used as a reference, such as the iliac crest, orbital-medial, sternal notch, symphysis pubis, xiphoid, lower coastal margin, external auditory meatus. See C.7.4.1.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Synchronization Frame of Reference UID
entry.description: UID of common synchronization environment. See C.7.4.2.1.1.

entry.name: Synchronization Trigger
entry.description: Data acquisition synchronization with external equipment Enumerated Values: SOURCE - this equipment provides synchronization channel or trigger to other equipment EXTERNAL - this equipment receives synchronization channel or trigger from other equipment PASSTHRU - this equipment receives synchronization channel or trigger and forwards it NO TRIGGER - data acquisition not synchronized by common channel or trigger

entry.name: Trigger Source or Type
entry.description: Specifies equipment ID of trigger source and/or type of trigger

entry.name: Synchronization Channel
entry.description: Identifier of waveform channel that records the synchronization channel or trigger, see C.7.4.2.1.3. Required if synchronization channel or trigger is encoded in a waveform in this SOP Instance

entry.name: Acquisition Time Synchronized
entry.description: Acquisition Datetime (0008,002A) synchronized with external time reference. Enumerated Values: Y, N See C.7.4.2.1.4

entry.name: Time Source
entry.description: ID of equipment or system providing time reference

entry.name: Time Distribution Protocol
entry.description: Method of time distribution used to synchronize this equipment. Defined Terms: NTP - Network Time Protocol IRIG - InterRange Instrumentation Group GPS - Global Positioning System SNTP ? Simple Network Time Protocol

entry.name: NTP Source Address
entry.description: IP Address of NTP time source. IPv4 addresses shall be in dotted decimal (e.g. 192.168.1.1). The IPv6 addresses shall be in colon separated hexadecimal (e.g. 12:34:56:78:9a:bc:de:f0). Note: Identity of this value in two instances acquired contemporaneously implies a common time base. The NTP Source Address may not persist over time.

entry.name: Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Institution Name
entry.description: Institution where the equipment that produced the composite instances is located.

entry.name: Institution Address
entry.description: Mailing address of the institution where the equipment that produced the composite instances is located.

entry.name: Station Name
entry.description: User defined name identifying the machine that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Institutional Department Name
entry.description: Department in the institution where the equipment that produced the composite instances is located.

entry.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that produced the composite instances. Note: This identifier corresponds to the device that actually created the images, such as a CR plate reader or a CT console, and may not be sufficient to identify all of the equipment in the imaging chain, such as the generator or gantry or plate.

entry.name: Software Versions
entry.description: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Gantry ID
entry.description: Identifier of the gantry or positioner.

entry.name: Spatial Resolution
entry.description: The inherent limiting resolution in mm of the acquisition equipment for high contrast objects for the data gathering and reconstruction technique chosen. If variable across the images of the series, the value at the image center.

entry.name: Date of Last Calibration
entry.description: Date when the image acquisition device calibration was last changed in any way. Multiple entries may be used for additional calibrations at other times. See C.7.5.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Time of Last Calibration
entry.description: Time when the image acquisition device calibration was last changed in any way. Multiple entries may be used. See C.7.5.1.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Pixel Padding Value
entry.description: Value of pixels not present in the native image added to an image to pad to rectangular format. See C.7.5.1.1.2 for further explanation. Note: The Value Representation of this Attribute is determined by the value of Pixel Representation (0028,0103).

entry.name: Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Software Versions
entry.description: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the equipment that produced the composite instances.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this image. Note: This Attribute was named Image Number in earlier versions of this Standard.

entry.name: Patient Orientation
entry.description: Patient direction of the rows and columns of the image. Required if image does not require Image Orientation (Patient) (0020,0037) and Image Position (Patient) (0020,0032). See C.7.6.1.1.1 for further explanation. Note: IOD's may have attributes other than Patient Orientation, Image Orientation, or Image Position (Patient) to describe orientation in which case this attribute will be zero length.

entry.name: Content Date
entry.description: The date the image pixel data creation started. Required if image is part of a series in which the images are temporally related. Note: This Attribute was formerly known as Image Date.

entry.name: Content Time
entry.description: The time the image pixel data creation started. Required if image is part of a series in which the images are temporally related.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.7.6.1.1.2 for Defined Terms and further explanation.

entry.name: Acquisition Number
entry.description: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this image.

entry.name: Acquisition Date
entry.description: The date the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started

entry.name: Acquisition Time
entry.description: The time the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started

entry.name: Acquisition Datetime
entry.description: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started. Note: The synchronization of this time with an external clock is specified in the Synchronization Module in Acquisition Time Synchronized (0018,1800).

include.ref: >Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that references other images significantly related to this image (e.g. post-localizer CT image or Mammographic biopsy or partial view images). One or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 7201.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Derivation Description
entry.description: A text description of how this image was derived. See C.7.6.1.1.3 for further explanation.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 7203.

entry.name: Derivation Code Sequence
entry.description: A coded description of how this image was derived. See C.7.6.1.1.3 for further explanation. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence. More than one Item indicates that successive derivation steps have been applied.

include.ref: >Include `Image SOP Instance Reference Macro' Table 10-3

entry.name: Source Image Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that identifies the set of Image SOP Class/Instance pairs of the Images that were used to derive this Image. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence. See C.7.6.1.1.4 for further explanation.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is 7202.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the reference is made, that is what role the source image or frame(s) played in the derivation of this image. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Spatial Locations Preserved
entry.description: The extent to which the spatial locations of all pixels are preserved during the processing of the source image that resulted in the current image Enumerated Values: YES NO REORIENTED_ONLY - A projection radiograph that has been flipped, and/or rotated by a multiple of 90 degrees Notes: 1. This applies not only to images with a known relationship to a 3D space, but also to projection images. For example, a projection radiograph such as a mammogram that is processed by a point image processing operation such as contrast enhancement, or a smoothing or edge enhancing convolution, would have a value of YES for this attribute. A projection radiograph that had been magnified or warped geometrically would have a value of NO for this attribute. A projection radiograph that has been flipped, and/or rotated by a multiple of 90 degrees, such that transformation of pixel locations is possible by comparison of the values of Patient Orientation (0020,0020) would have a value of REORIENTED_ONLY. This attribute is typically of importance in relating images with Presentation Intent Type (0008,0068) values of FOR PROCESSING and FOR PRESENTATION. 2. When the value of this attribute is NO, it is not possible to locate on the current image any pixel coordinates that are referenced relative to the source image, such as for example, might be required for rendering CAD findings derived from a referenced FOR PROCESSING image on the current FOR PRESENTATION image.

entry.name: >Patient Orientation
entry.description: The Patient Orientation values of the source image. Required if the value of Spatial Locations Preserved (0028,135A) is REORIENTED_ONLY.

entry.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: A sequence which provides reference to a set of non-image SOP Class/Instance pairs significantly related to this Image, including waveforms that may or may not be temporally synchronized with this image . One or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Defined Context ID is CID 7004 for referenced

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Code describing the purpose of the reference to the Instance(s). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence. waveforms.

entry.name: Images in Acquisition
entry.description: Number of images that resulted from this acquisition of data

entry.name: Image Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments about the image

entry.name: Quality Control Image
entry.description: Indicates whether or not this image is a quality control or phantom image. Enumerated Values: YES NO If this Attribute is absent, then the image may or may not be a quality control or phantom image. The phantom device in the image can be described using the Device Module. See C.7.6.12

entry.name: Burned In Annotation
entry.description: Indicates whether or not image contains sufficient burned in annotation to identify the patient and date the image was acquired. Enumerated Values: YES NO If this Attribute is absent, then the image may or may not contain burned in annotation.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression Ratio
entry.description: Describes the approximate lossy compression ratio(s) that have been applied to this image. See C.7.6.1.1.5 for further explanation. May be multivalued if successive lossy compression steps have been applied. Notes: 1. For example, a compression ratio of 30:1 would be described in this Attribute with a single value of 30. 2. For historical reasons, the lossy compression ratio may also be described in Derivation Description (0008,2111).

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression Method
entry.description: A label for the lossy compression method(s) that have been applied to this image. See C.7.6.1.1.5 for further explanation. May be multivalued if successive lossy compression steps have been applied; the value order shall correspond to the values of Lossy Image Compression Ratio (0028,2112). Note: For historical reasons, the lossy compression method may also be described in Derivation Description (0008,2111).

include.ref: > Include `Image Pixel Macro' Table C.7-11b See C.7.6.1.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Icon Image Sequence
entry.description: This icon image is representative of the Image.

entry.name: Presentation LUT Shape
entry.description: When present, specifies an identity transformation for the Presentation LUT such that the output of all grayscale transformations, if any, are defined to be in P-Values. Enumerated Values are: IDENTITY - output is in P-Values - shall be used if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2 or any color photometric interpretation. INVERSE - output after inversion is in P- Values - shall be used if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME1. When this attribute is used with a color photometric interpretation then the luminance component is in P-Values.

entry.name: Irradiation Event UID
entry.description: Unique identification of the irradiation event(s) associated with the acquisition of this image. See C.7.6.1.1.7.

entry.name: Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance in the patient between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: Image Orientation (Patient)
entry.description: The direction cosines of the first row and the first column with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Image Position (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates of the upper left hand corner (center of the first voxel transmitted) of the image, in mm. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Slice Thickness
entry.description: Nominal slice thickness, in mm.

entry.name: Slice Location
entry.description: Relative position of exposure expressed in mm. C.7.6.2.1.2 for further explanation.

include.ref: Include `Image Pixel Macro' Table C.7-11b

entry.name: Pixel Data Provider URL
entry.description: A URL of a provider service that supplies the pixel data of the Image. Required if the image is to be transferred in one of the following presentation contexts identified by Transfer Syntax UID: 1.2.840.10008.1.2.4.94 (DICOM JPIP Referenced Transfer Syntax) 1.2.840.10008.1.2.4.95 (DICOM JPIP Referenced Deflate Transfer Syntax)

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.7.6.3.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.7.6.3.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Rows
entry.description: Number of rows in the image.

entry.name: Columns
entry.description: Number of columns in the image

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Pixel Representation
entry.description: Data representation of the pixel samples. Each sample shall have the same pixel representation. Enumerated Values: 0000H = unsigned integer. 0001H = 2's complement

entry.name: Pixel Data
entry.description: A data stream of the pixel samples that comprise the Image. See C.7.6.3.1.4 for further explanation. Required if Pixel Data Provider URL (0028,7FE0) is not present.

entry.name: Planar Configuration
entry.description: Indicates whether the pixel data are sent color-by-plane or color-by-pixel. Required if Samples per Pixel (0028,0002) has a value greater than 1. See C.7.6.3.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: Pixel Aspect Ratio
entry.description: Ratio of the vertical size and horizontal size of the pixels in the image specified by a pair of integer values where the first value is the vertical pixel size, and the second value is the horizontal pixel size. Required if the aspect ratio is not 1\1 and the Image Plane Module or the Pixel Measures Macro is not applicable to this Image. See C.7.6.3.1.7.

entry.name: Smallest Image Pixel Value
entry.description: The minimum actual pixel value encountered in this image.

entry.name: Largest Image Pixel Value
entry.description: The maximum actual pixel value encountered in this image.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201) Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR or Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) at the image level equals COLOR or MIXED. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1202) Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR or Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) at the image level equals COLOR or MIXED. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1203) Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR or Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) at the image level equals COLOR or MIXED. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR or Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) at the image level equals COLOR or MIXED. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR or Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) at the image level equals COLOR or MIXED. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR or Pixel Presentation (0008,9205) at the image level equals COLOR or MIXED. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: ICC Profile
entry.description: An ICC Profile encoding the transformation of device-dependent color stored pixel values into PCS-Values. See Section C.11.15.1.1.1. When present, defines the color space of color Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) values, and the output of Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201-1203). Note: The profile applies only to the Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) attribute at the same level of the dataset and not to any icons nested within sequences, which may or may not have their own ICC profile specified.

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Agent
entry.description: Contrast or bolus agent

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 12.

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Agent Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the contrast agent. One or more Items may be present.

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Route
entry.description: Administration route of contrast agent

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11.

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Administration Route Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the route of administration of contrast agent. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Additional Drug Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies any additional drug that is administered with the contrast agent bolus. One or more Items may be present.

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Volume
entry.description: Volume injected in milliliters of diluted contrast agent

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Start Time
entry.description: Time of start of injection

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Stop Time
entry.description: Time of end of contrast injection

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Total Dose
entry.description: Total amount in milliliters of the undiluted contrast agent

entry.name: Contrast Flow Rate
entry.description: Rate(s) of injection(s) in milliliters/sec

entry.name: Contrast Flow Duration
entry.description: Duration(s) of injection(s) in seconds. Each Contrast Flow Duration value shall correspond to a value of Contrast Flow Rate (0018,1046).

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Ingredient
entry.description: Active ingredient of agent. Defined Terms: IODINE GADOLINIUM CARBON DIOXIDE BARIUM

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Concentration
entry.description: Milligrams of active ingredient per milliliter of (diluted) agent

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 12.

entry.name: Contrast/Bolus Agent Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies one or more contrast agents administered prior to or during the acquisition. Shall contain one or more Items.

entry.name: >Contrast/Bolus Agent Number
entry.description: Identifying number, unique within this SOP Instance, of the agent administered. Used to reference this particular agent from the Contrast/Bolus Functional Group Macro. The number shall be 1 for the first Item and increase by 1 for each subsequent Item.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11.

entry.name: >Contrast/Bolus Administration Route Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the route of administration of contrast agent. Shall contain exactly one Item.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 13.

entry.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Code Sequence
entry.description: Active ingredient of agent. Zero or more Items may be included in the Sequence.

entry.name: >Contrast/Bolus Volume
entry.description: Total volume administered in milliliters of diluted contrast agent.

entry.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Concentration
entry.description: Milligrams of active ingredient per milliliter of agent.

entry.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Opaque
entry.description: Absorption of the ingredient greater than the absorption of water (tissue). Enumerated Values: YES NO See Section C.7.6.4b.1.

entry.name: >Contrast Administration Profile Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes one or more phases of contrast administered. If present, shall contain one or more Items.

entry.name: >>Contrast/Bolus Volume
entry.description: Volume administered during this phase in milliliters of diluted contrast agent.

entry.name: >>Contrast/Bolus Start Time
entry.description: Time of start of administration.

entry.name: >>Contrast/Bolus Stop Time
entry.description: Time of end of administration.

entry.name: >>Contrast Flow Rate
entry.description: Rate of administration in milliliters/sec. Only a single value shall be present.

entry.name: >>Contrast Flow Duration
entry.description: Duration of injection in seconds. Only a single value shall be present.

entry.name: Preferred Playback Sequencing
entry.description: Describes the preferred playback sequencing for a multi-frame image. Enumerated Values: 0 = Looping (1,2...n,1,2,...n,1,2,....n,...) 1 = Sweeping (1,2,...n,n-1,...2,1,2,...n,...)

entry.name: Frame Time
entry.description: Nominal time (in msec) per individual frame. See C.7.6.5.1.1 for further explanation. Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Time.

entry.name: Frame Time Vector
entry.description: An array that contains the real time increments (in msec) between frames for a Multi-frame image. See C.7.6.5.1.2 for further explanation. Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Time Vector. Note: Frame Time Vector arrays may not be properly encoded if Explicit-VR transfer syntax is used and the VL of this attribute exceeds 65534 bytes.

entry.name: Start Trim
entry.description: The frame number of the first frame of the Multi-frame image to be displayed.

entry.name: Stop Trim
entry.description: The Frame Number of the last frame of a Multi-frame image to be displayed.

entry.name: Recommended Display Frame Rate
entry.description: Recommended rate at which the frames of a Multi-frame image should be displayed in frames/second.

entry.name: Cine Rate
entry.description: Number of frames per second.

entry.name: Frame Delay
entry.description: Time (in msec) from Content Time (0008,0033) to the start of the first frame in a Multi-frame image.

entry.name: Image Trigger Delay
entry.description: Delay time in milliseconds from trigger (e.g., X-ray on pulse) to the first frame of a Multi-frame image.

entry.name: Effective Duration
entry.description: Total time in seconds that data was actually taken for the entire Multi-frame image.

entry.name: Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Elapsed time of data acquisition in msec per each frame.

entry.name: Multiplexed Audio Channels Description Code Sequence
entry.description: Description of any multiplexed audio channels. See Section C.7.6.5.1.3. Required if the Transfer Syntax used to encode the multi-frame image contains multiplexed (interleaved) audio channels, such as is possible with MPEG2. Zero or more items may be present in this sequence.

entry.name: >Channel Identification Code
entry.description: A reference to the audio channel as identified within Transfer Syntax encoded bit stream (1 for the main channel, 2 for the second channel and 3 to 9 to the complementary channels).

entry.name: >Channel Mode
entry.description: A coded descriptor qualifying the mode of the channel: Enumerated Values: MONO = 1 signal STEREO = 2 simultaneously acquired (left and right) signals

include.ref: >>Include 'Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1. Defined Context ID Audio Channel Source 3000.

entry.name: >Channel Source Sequence
entry.description: A coded descriptor of the audio channel source. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Number of Frames
entry.description: Number of frames in a Multi-frame Image. See C.7.6.6.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Frame Increment Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute that is used as the frame increment in Multi-frame pixel data. See C.7.6.6.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Representative Frame Number
entry.description: The frame number selected for use as a pictorial representation (e.g. icon) of the Multi-frame Image

entry.name: Frame Numbers Of Interest (FOI)
entry.description: Frame number(s) selected as frames of interest. A frame number may appear more than once.

entry.name: Frame Of Interest Description
entry.description: Description of each one of the Frame(s) of Interest selected in (0028,6020). If multiple Frames of Interest are selected and this Attribute is used, it shall contain the same number of values as are in Frame Numbers of Interest (0028,6020).

entry.name: Frame of Interest Type
entry.description: A defined term for each one of the Frame(s) of Interest (0028,6020) that identifies the significance of the frame. If multiple Frames of Interest are selected and this Attribute is used, it shall contain the same number of values as are in Frame Numbers of Interest (0028,6020). Defined Terms are: HIGHMI = a frame acquired at the time of the high power pulse that destroys acoustic contrast RWAVE = the frame closest to the R- Wave TRIGGER = a trigger frame, for example a set delay from the R Wave ENDSYSTOLE = the frame closest to end of systole, at the end of the T-wave

entry.name: Mask Subtraction Sequence
entry.description: Defines a sequence that describes mask subtraction operations for a Multi- frame Image.

entry.name: >Mask Operation
entry.description: Defined Term identifying the type of mask operation to be performed. See C.7.6.10.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Subtraction Item ID
entry.description: Identification of the Subtraction Item used to associate a certain Mask Sub- Pixel Shift (0028,6114) in the Frame Pixel Shift Functional Group. See C.7.6.16.2.14.1. Required if SOP Class UID (0008,0016) equals "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.12.1.1" or "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.12.2.1". May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Applicable Frame Range
entry.description: Each pair of numbers in this multi- valued attribute specify a beginning and ending frame number inclusive of a range where this particular mask operation is valid. Discontinuous ranges are represented by multiple pairs of numbers. Frames in a Multi- frame Image are specified by sequentially increasing number values beginning with 1. If this Attribute is missing in this particular sequence item, then the mask operation is applicable throughout the entire Multi- frame Image, subject to certain limits as described in C.7.6.10.1.1. Required if Mask Operation (0028,6101) equals REV_TID. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: >Mask Frame Numbers
entry.description: Specifies the frame numbers of the pixel data used to generate this mask. Frames in a Multi-frame Image are specified by sequentially increasing number values beginning with 1. Required if the Mask Operation (0028,6101) is AVG_SUB.

entry.name: >Contrast Frame Averaging
entry.description: Specifies the number of contrast frames to average together before performing the mask operation. If the Attribute is missing, no averaging is performed.

entry.name: >Mask Sub-pixel Shift
entry.description: A pair of floating point numbers specifying the fractional vertical [adjacent row spacing] and horizontal [adjacent column spacing] pixel shift applied to the mask before subtracting it from the contrast frame. See Section C.7.6.10.1.2. Note: When the Frame Pixel Shift Functional Group is present the values of the Mask Pixel Shift attribute of that Functional Group prevails over the values specified in this module.

entry.name: >TID Offset
entry.description: If Mask Operation is TID, specifies the offset to be subtracted from the current frame number in order to locate the mask frame in TID mode. If Mask Operation is REV_TID, specifies the initial offset to be subtracted from the first contrast frame number. See section C.7.6.10.1.1. If zero length, TID Offset defaults to 1. Required if Mask Operation (0028,6101) is TID or REV_TID.

entry.name: >Mask Operation Explanation
entry.description: Free form explanation of this particular mask operation.

entry.name: >Mask Selection Mode
entry.description: Specifies the method of selection of the mask operations of this item. Defined Terms: SYSTEM USER

entry.name: Recommended Viewing Mode
entry.description: Specifies the recommended viewing protocol(s). Defined terms: SUB = for subtraction with mask images; NAT = native viewing of image as sent. Note: If an implementation does not recognize the defined term for Recommended Viewing Mode (0028,1090) , reverting to native display mode is recommended.

include.ref: Include `Display Shutter Macro' Table C.7-17A.
>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 4051.

entry.name: Device Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of items describing devices used that may be visible in the image. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the device

entry.name: >Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the device

entry.name: >Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the device

entry.name: >Device ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for the device

entry.name: >Device Length
entry.description: Length in mm of device. See C.7.6.12.1.1.

entry.name: >Device Diameter
entry.description: Unit diameter of device. See C.7.6.12.1.1.

entry.name: >Device Diameter Units
entry.description: Required if Device Diameter (0050,0016) is present. Defined terms: FR = French GA = Gauge IN = Inch MM = Millimeter

entry.name: >Device Volume
entry.description: Volume of device in ml. See C.7.6.12.1.1..

entry.name: >Inter-Marker Distance
entry.description: Distance in mm between markers on calibrated device. See C.7.6.12.1.1.

entry.name: >Device Description
entry.description: Further description in free form text describing the device.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 9.

entry.name: Intervention Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of items describing interventional therapies or procedures. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Intervention Status
entry.description: Temporal relation of SOP Instance to intervention Enumerated Values: PRE INTERMEDIATE POST NONE

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 10.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the interventional drug. Only one item shall be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Start Time
entry.description: Time of administration of the interventional drug.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Stop Time
entry.description: Time of completion of administration of the intervention drug.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11.

entry.name: > Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the Administration Route. This sequence shall contain exactly one item.

entry.name: >Intervention Description
entry.description: Further description in free form text describing the therapy or other intervention.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201). Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1202). Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
entry.description: Specifies the format of the Blue Palette Color Lookup table Data (0028,1203). Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Palette Color Lookup Table UID
entry.description: Palette Color Lookup Table UID. See C.7.9.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is NOT used in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is NOT used in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is NOT used in an Image IOD, or if the IOD is a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.6.3.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: Segmented Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Segmented Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is used in an Image IOD; shall not be present in a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.9.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Segmented Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Segmented Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is used in an Image IOD; shall not be present in a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.9.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Segmented Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
entry.description: Segmented Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data. Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) has a value of PALETTE COLOR and segmented data is used in an Image IOD; shall not be present in a Presentation State IOD. See C.7.9.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Body Part Examined
entry.description: Text description of the part of the body examined. Defined Terms: SKULL CSPINE TSPINE LSPINE SSPINE COCCYX CHEST CLAVICLE BREAST ABDOMEN PELVIS HIP SHOULDER ELBOW KNEE ANKLE HAND FOOT EXTREMITY HEAD HEART NECK LEG ARM JAW

entry.name: View Position
entry.description: Radiographic view associated with Patient Position (0018,5100). Defined Terms: AP = Anterior/Posterior PA = Posterior/Anterior LL = Left Lateral RL = Right Lateral RLD = Right Lateral Decubitus LLD = Left Lateral Decubitus RLO = Right Lateral Oblique LLO = Left Lateral Oblique

entry.name: Filter Type
entry.description: Label for the type of filter inserted into the x-ray beam

entry.name: Collimator/grid Name
entry.description: Label describing any grid inserted.

entry.name: Focal Spot
entry.description: Size of the focal spot in mm. For devices with variable focal spot or multiple focal spots, small dimension followed by large dimension.

entry.name: Plate Type
entry.description: Label of the type of storage phosphor plates used in this series

entry.name: Phosphor Type
entry.description: Label of type of phosphor on the plates

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. Shall have one of the following Enumerated Values: MONOCHROME1 MONOCHROME2

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the x-ray generator used

entry.name: Plate ID
entry.description: The ID or serial number of the sensing plate upon which the image was acquired

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view) . Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Exposure Time
entry.description: Time of x-ray exposure in msec

entry.name: X-ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-ray Tube Current in mA.

entry.name: Exposure
entry.description: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure in ?As
entry.description: The exposure expressed in ?As, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

include.ref: Include Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro (Table 10-10)

entry.name: Imager Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance measured at the front plane of the Image Receptor housing between the center of each pixel. Specified by a numeric pair - row spacing value (delimiter) column spacing value - in mm. In the case of CR, the front plane is defined to be the external surface of the CR plate closest to the patient and radiation source.

entry.name: Generator Power
entry.description: Power in kW to the x-ray generator.

entry.name: Acquisition Device Processing Description
entry.description: Describes device-specific processing associated with the image (e.g. Organ Description)

entry.name: Acquisition Device Processing Code
entry.description: Code representing the device-specific processing associated with the image (e.g. CR Organ Filtering code)

entry.name: Cassette Orientation
entry.description: Orientation of cassette, used to properly position the image for display. Enumerated Values: LANDSCAPE PORTRAIT

entry.name: Cassette Size
entry.description: Size of cassette. Defined Terms: 18CMX24CM 8INX10IN 24CMX30CM 10INX12IN 30CMX35CM 30CMX40CM 11INX14IN 35CMX35CM 14INX14IN 35CMX43CM 14INX17IN

entry.name: Exposures on Plate
entry.description: Total number of x-ray exposures that have been made on the plate identified in Plate ID (0018,1004)

entry.name: Relative X-ray Exposure
entry.description: Relative x-ray exposure on the plate. Meaning of values is implementation specific. May be used to adjust the dynamic range of the plate digitizer (scanner).

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7

entry.name: Sensitivity
entry.description: Read out sensitivity. Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4009.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.2.1.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.2.1.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.2.1.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.2.1.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See C.8.2.1.1.5 for specialization.

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. See C.8.2.1.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Rescale Intercept
entry.description: The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and Hounsfield (HU). HU = m*SV+b

entry.name: Rescale Slope
entry.description: m in the equation specified in Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

entry.name: KVP
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the x-ray generator used

entry.name: Acquisition Number
entry.description: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time which resulted in this image

entry.name: Scan Options
entry.description: Parameters of scanning sequence.

entry.name: Data Collection Diameter
entry.description: The diameter in mm of the region over which data were collected

entry.name: Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: Diameter in mm of the region from within which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Patient
entry.description: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view). Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Object Distance (SOD).

entry.name: Gantry/Detector Tilt
entry.description: Nominal angle of tilt in degrees of the scanning gantry. Not intended for mathematical computations.

entry.name: Table Height
entry.description: The distance in mm of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation; below the center is positive.

entry.name: Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of rotation of the source when relevant, about nearest principal axis of equipment. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter clockwise

entry.name: Exposure Time
entry.description: Time of x-ray exposure in msec

entry.name: X-ray Tube Current
entry.description: X-ray Tube Current in mA.

entry.name: Exposure
entry.description: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Exposure in ?As
entry.description: The exposure expressed in ?As, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-ray Tube Current.

entry.name: Filter Type
entry.description: Label for the type of filter inserted into the x-ray beam.

entry.name: Generator Power
entry.description: Power in kW to the x-ray generator.

entry.name: Focal Spot
entry.description: Size of the focal spot in mm. For devices with variable focal spot or multiple focal spots, small dimension followed by large dimension.

entry.name: Convolution Kernel
entry.description: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data

entry.name: Revolution Time
entry.description: The time in seconds of a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.

entry.name: Single Collimation Width
entry.description: The width of a single row of acquired data (in mm). Note: Adjacent physical detector rows may have been combined to form a single effective acquisition row.

entry.name: Total Collimation Width
entry.description: The width of the total collimation (in mm) over the area of active x-ray detection. Note: This will be equal the number of effective detector rows multiplied by single collimation width.

entry.name: Table Speed
entry.description: The distance in mm that the table moves in one second during the gathering of data that resulted in this image.

entry.name: Table Feed per Rotation
entry.description: Motion of the table (in mm) during a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.

entry.name: Spiral Pitch Factor
entry.description: Ratio of the Table Feed per Rotation (0018,9310) to the Total Collimation Width (0018,9307).

entry.name: Exposure Modulation Type
entry.description: A label describing the type of exposure modulation used for the purpose of limiting the dose. Defined Terms: NONE

entry.name: Estimated Dose Saving
entry.description: A percent value of dose saving due to the use of Exposure Modulation Type (0018,9323). A negative percent value of dose savings reflects an increase of exposure.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7

entry.name: CTDIvol
entry.description: Computed Tomography Dose Index (CTDIvol), im mGy according to IEC 60601-2-44, Ed.2.1 (Clause 29.1.103.4), The Volume CTDIvol. It describes the average dose for this image for the selected CT conditions of operation. Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4030.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.3.1.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (planes) in this image. See C.8.3.1.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.3.1.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See C.8.3.1.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Scanning Sequence
entry.description: Description of the type of data taken. Enumerated Values: SE = Spin Echo IR = Inversion Recovery GR = Gradient Recalled EP = Echo Planar RM = Research Mode Note: Multi-valued, but not all combinations are valid (e.g. SE/GR, etc.).

entry.name: Sequence Variant
entry.description: Variant of the Scanning Sequence. Defined Terms: SK = segmented k-space MTC = magnetization transfer contrast SS = steady state TRSS = time reversed steady state SP = spoiled MP = MAG prepared OSP = oversampling phase NONE = no sequence variant

entry.name: Scan Options
entry.description: Parameters of scanning sequence. Defined Terms: PER = Phase Encode Reordering RG = Respiratory Gating CG = Cardiac Gating PPG = Peripheral Pulse Gating FC = Flow Compensation PFF = Partial Fourier - Frequency PFP = Partial Fourier - Phase SP = Spatial Presaturation FS = Fat Saturation

entry.name: MR Acquisition Type
entry.description: Identification of data encoding scheme. Enumerated Values: 2D = frequency x phase 3D = frequency x phase x phase

entry.name: Repetition Time
entry.description: The period of time in msec between the beginning of a pulse sequence and the beginning of the succeeding (essentially identical) pulse sequence. Required except when Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) is EP and Sequence Variant (0018,0021) is not SK.

entry.name: Echo Time
entry.description: Time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced (kx=0). In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the middle of the excitation pulse to the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space (i.e.-kx=0, ky=0).

entry.name: Echo Train Length
entry.description: Number of lines in k-space acquired per excitation per image.

entry.name: Inversion Time
entry.description: Time in msec after the middle of inverting RF pulse to middle of excitation pulse to detect the amount of longitudinal magnetization. Required if Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) has values of IR.

entry.name: Trigger Time
entry.description: Time, in msec, between peak of the R wave and the peak of the echo produced. In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k- space. Required for Scan Options (0018,0022) which include heart gating (e.g. CG, PPG, etc.)

entry.name: Sequence Name
entry.description: User defined name for the Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) and Sequence Variant (0018,0021) combination.

entry.name: Angio Flag
entry.description: Angio Image Indicator. Primary image for Angio processing. Enumerated Values: Y = Image is Angio N = Image is not Angio

entry.name: Number of Averages
entry.description: Number of times a given pulse sequence is repeated before any parameter is changed

entry.name: Imaging Frequency
entry.description: Precession frequency in MHz of the nucleus being addressed

entry.name: Imaged Nucleus
entry.description: Nucleus that is resonant at the imaging frequency. Examples: 31P, 1H

entry.name: Echo Number
entry.description: The echo number used in generating this image. In the case of segmented k-space, it is the effective Echo Number.

entry.name: Magnetic Field Strength
entry.description: Nominal field strength of MR magnet, in Tesla

entry.name: Spacing Between Slices
entry.description: Spacing between slices, in mm. The spacing is measured from the center-to- center of each slice.

entry.name: Number of Phase Encoding Steps
entry.description: Total number of lines in k-space in the 'y' direction collected during acquisition.

entry.name: Percent Sampling
entry.description: Fraction of acquisition matrix lines acquired, expressed as a percent.

entry.name: Percent Phase Field of View
entry.description: Ratio of field of view dimension in phase direction to field of view dimension in frequency direction, expressed as a percent.

entry.name: Pixel Bandwidth
entry.description: Reciprocal of the total sampling period, in hertz per pixel.

entry.name: Nominal Interval
entry.description: Average R-R interval used for the scans, in msec

entry.name: Beat Rejection Flag
entry.description: Beat length sorting has been applied. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = No

entry.name: Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: Intervals Acquired
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals acquired.

entry.name: Intervals Rejected
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals rejected.

entry.name: PVC Rejection
entry.description: Description of type of PVC rejection criteria used.

entry.name: Skip Beats
entry.description: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia.

entry.name: Heart Rate
entry.description: Beats per minute.

entry.name: Cardiac Number of Images
entry.description: Number of images per cardiac cycle.

entry.name: Trigger Window
entry.description: Percent of R-R interval, based on Heart Rate (0018,1088), prescribed as a window for a valid/usable trigger.

entry.name: Reconstruction Diameter
entry.description: Diameter in mm. of the region from within which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.

entry.name: Receive Coil Name
entry.description: Receive coil used.

entry.name: Transmit Coil Name
entry.description: Transmit coil used.

entry.name: Acquisition Matrix
entry.description: Dimensions of the acquired frequency /phase data before reconstruction. Multi-valued: frequency rows\frequency columns\phase rows\phase columns.

entry.name: In-plane Phase Encoding Direction
entry.description: The axis of phase encoding with respect to the image. Enumerated Values: ROW = phase encoded in rows. COL = phase encoded in columns.

entry.name: Flip Angle
entry.description: Steady state angle in degrees to which the magnetic vector is flipped from the magnetic vector of the primary field.

entry.name: SAR
entry.description: Calculated whole body Specific Absorption Rate in watts/kilogram.

entry.name: Variable Flip Angle Flag
entry.description: Flip angle variation applied during image acquisition. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no

entry.name: dB/dt
entry.description: The rate of change of the gradient coil magnetic flux density with time (T/s).

entry.name: Temporal Position Identifier
entry.description: Temporal order of a dynamic or functional set of Images.

entry.name: Number of Temporal Positions
entry.description: Total number of temporal positions prescribed.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7

entry.name: Temporal Resolution
entry.description: Time delta between Images in a dynamic or functional set of Images. Defined Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is 4030.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 19.

entry.name: Patient Orientation Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. See C.8.4.6.1.1 for further explanation. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of "99SDM" for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 20.

entry.name: > Patient Orientation Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: Patient Orientation Modifier. Required if needed to fully specify the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. See C.8.4.6.1.2 for further explanation. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of "99SDM" for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

include.ref: >Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 21.

entry.name: Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence which describes the orientation of the patient with respect to the gantry. See Section C.8.4.6.1.3 for further explanation. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of "99SDM" for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Samples per Pixel
entry.description: Number of samples (color planes) in this image. The value shall be 1.

entry.name: Photometric Interpretation
entry.description: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data. See C.8.4.7.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: Bits Allocated
entry.description: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. Enumerated Values: 8, 16.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. The value shall be the same as the value in Bits Allocated (0028,0100).

entry.name: High Bit
entry.description: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. Shall be one less than the value in Bits Stored (0028,0101).

entry.name: Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance in the patient between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing, in mm. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order.

entry.name: Frame Increment Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tags of one or more frame index vectors. See C.8.4.8.1.1 for further specialization.

entry.name: Energy Window Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the energy window number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Energy Window Vector (0054,0010). See C.8.4.8.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Energy Windows
entry.description: Number of energy window groupings. See C.8.4.8.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Detector Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the detector number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Detector Vector (0054,0020). See C.8.4.8.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Detectors
entry.description: Number of detectors. See C.8.4.8.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Phase Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the phase number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030). See C.8.4.8.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Phases
entry.description: Number of phases. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030). See C.8.4.8.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Rotation Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the rotation number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Rotation Vector (0054,0050). See C.8.4.8.1.5 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Rotations
entry.description: Number of rotations. Required if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3 is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO, or RECON GATED TOMO. See C.8.4.8.1.5 for specialization.

entry.name: R-R Interval Vector
