entry.description: An array which contains the R-R interval number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). See C.8.4.8.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of R-R Intervals
entry.description: Number of R-R intervals. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). See C.8.4.8.1.6 for specialization.

entry.name: Time Slot Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the time slot number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070). See C.8.4.8.1.7 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Time Slots
entry.description: Number of time slots. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070). See C.8.4.8.1.7 for specialization.

entry.name: Slice Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the spatial slice number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Slice Vector (0054,0080). See C.8.4.8.1.8 for specialization.

entry.name: Number of Slices
entry.description: Number of slices. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Slice Vector (0054,0080). See C.8.4.8.1.8 for specialization.

entry.name: Angular View Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the angular view number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Angular View Vector (0054,0090). See C.8.4.8.1.9 for specialization.

entry.name: Time Slice Vector
entry.description: An array which contains the time slice number for each frame. Required if the value of the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) includes the Tag for Time Slice Vector (0054,0100). See C.8.4.8.1.10 for specialization.

entry.name: Image Type
entry.description: Image identification characteristics. See C.8.4.9.1.1 for specialization.

entry.name: Image ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated Image identifier.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5 Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image.

entry.name: Counts Accumulated
entry.description: Sum of all gamma events for all frames in the image. See C.8.4.9.1.2 for specialization.

entry.name: Acquisition Termination Condition
entry.description: Description of how the data collection was stopped. Defined Terms: CNTS = counts DENS = density MANU = manual OVFL = data overflow TIME = time TRIG = physiological trigger See C.8.4.9.1.3 for specialization.

entry.name: Table Height
entry.description: The height of the patient table in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: Table Traverse
entry.description: Location of the patient table (or gantry relative to the table) in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Elapsed time for data acquisition in msec. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is: WHOLE BODY or STATIC. See C.8.4.9.1.4 for specialization.

entry.name: Count Rate
entry.description: Maximum count rate achieved during the acquisition in counts/sec.

entry.name: Processing Function
entry.description: Code or description of processing functions applied to the data.

entry.name: Corrected Image
entry.description: A value that indicates which, if any, corrections have been applied to the image. Corrections are applied to all frames in the image. Defined Terms: UNIF = flood corrected COR = center of rotation corrected NCO = non-circular orbit corrected DECY = decay corrected ATTN = attenuation corrected SCAT = scatter corrected DTIM = dead time corrected NRGY = energy corrected LIN = linearity corrected MOTN = motion corrected CLN = count loss normalization; Any type of normalization applied to correct for count loss in Time Slots.

entry.name: Whole Body Technique
entry.description: The type of scan performed. Used only if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, contains the value WHOLE BODY. Enumerated Values: 1PS = one pass 2PS = two pass PCN = patient contour following employed MSP = multiple static frames collected into a whole body frame.

entry.name: Scan Velocity
entry.description: The speed of the camera motion over the body in mm/sec. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 contains the value WHOLE BODY.

entry.name: Scan Length
entry.description: Size of the imaged area in the direction of scanning motion, in mm. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 contains the value WHOLE BODY.

include.ref: Include 'General Anatomy Optional Macro' Table 10-7

entry.name: Trigger Source or Type
entry.description: Text indicating trigger source. Defined Term: EKG No Context ID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is defined.

entry.name: Energy Window Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe the energy window groups used. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Energy Windows (0054,0011). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Energy Window Vector (0054,0010), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Energy Window Name
entry.description: A user defined name which describes this Energy Window.

entry.name: >Energy Window Range Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes this energy window group.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Lower Limit
entry.description: The lower limit of the energy window in KeV. See C.8.4.10.1.1 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Upper Limit
entry.description: The upper limit of the energy window in KeV. See C.8.4.10.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: Radiopharmaceutical Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe isotope information. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 18.

entry.name: >Radionuclide Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radionuclide. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Required if a sequence Item is present. The Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) shall have an Enumerated Value of "99SDM" for historical reasons. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Route
entry.description: Route of injection.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11.

entry.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the administration route for the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Volume
entry.description: Volume of injection in cubic cm.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Start Time
entry.description: Time of start of injection. See C.8.4.10.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Stop Time
entry.description: Time of end of injection. See C.8.4.10.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Radionuclide Total Dose
entry.description: Total amount of radionuclide injected. See C.8.4.10.1.7 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Calibration Data Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that contains calibration data.

entry.name: >>Energy Window Number
entry.description: The Item number in the Energy Window Information Sequence to which the following calibration data relates. The Items are numbered starting from 1. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Syringe Counts
entry.description: Pre-injection syringe count rate in counts/sec. See C.8.4.10.1.8 for further explanation.

entry.name: >>Residual Syringe Counts
entry.description: Post-injection residue syringe count rate in counts/sec. See C.8.4.10.1.9 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical
entry.description: Name of the radiopharmaceutical.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 25.

entry.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the radiopharmaceutical. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Intervention Drug Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describes the intervention drugs used. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Name
entry.description: Name of intervention drug.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 10.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the intervention drug name. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 11.

entry.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the administration route for the intervention drug. This sequence shall contain exactly one item. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Start Time
entry.description: Time of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for the Acquisition Start Time (0008,0032).

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Stop Time
entry.description: Time of completion of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for the Acquisition Start Time (0008,0032).

entry.name: >Intervention Drug Dose
entry.description: Intervention drug dose, in mg.

entry.name: Detector Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe the detectors used. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Detectors (0054,0021). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Detector Vector (0054,0020), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Collimator/Grid Name
entry.description: Label describing the collimator used (LEAP, hires, etc.)

entry.name: >Collimator Type
entry.description: Collimator type. Defined Terms: PARA = Parallel (default) PINH = Pinhole FANB = Fan-beam CONE = Cone-beam SLNT = Slant hole ASTG = Astigmatic DIVG = Diverging NONE = No collimator UNKN = Unknown Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Field of View Shape
entry.description: Shape of the field of view of the Nuclear Medicine detector. Defined Terms: RECTANGLE ROUND HEXAGONAL

entry.name: >Field of View Dimension(s)
entry.description: Dimensions of the field of view, in mm. If Field of View Shape (0018,1147) is: RECTANGLE: row dimension followed by column. ROUND: diameter. HEXAGONAL: diameter of a circumscribed circle.

entry.name: >Focal Distance
entry.description: Focal distance, in mm. A value of 0 means infinite distance for parallel collimation. See C.8.4.11.1.1 for further specialization. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >X Focus Center
entry.description: Center of focus along a row. See C.8.4.11.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Y Focus Center
entry.description: Center of focus along a column. See C.8.4.11.1.2 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Zoom Center
entry.description: The amount of offset from (0,0) applied to each pixel in the image before application of the zoom factor, specified by a numeric pair: row value (delimiter) column value (in mm). See C.8.4.11.1.3 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Zoom Factor
entry.description: The amount of magnification applied to each pixel in the image, specified by a numeric pair: row value (delimiter) column value. See C.8.4.11.1.4 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Center of Rotation Offset
entry.description: Average center of rotation offset of Nuclear Medicine detector in mm. See C.8.4.11.1.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Gantry/Detector Tilt
entry.description: Angle of tilt in degrees of the detector. See C.8.4.11.1.6 for further explanation.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 4 is TRANSMISSION, Value 3 is not TOMO, and a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Start Angle
entry.description: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of the acquisition, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter- clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: > Radial Position
entry.description: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

entry.name: >Image Orientation (Patient)
entry.description: The direction cosines of the first row and the first column with respect to the patient. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Image Position (Patient)
entry.description: The x, y, and z coordinates of the upper left hand corner (center of the first voxel transmitted) of the image, in mm. See C.7.6.2.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

include.ref: >>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 26 .

entry.name: >View Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the projection of the anatomic region of interest on the image receptor. See Section C.8.4.11.1.7 for further explanation. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

include.ref: >>>Include `Code Sequence Macro' Table 8.8-1 Baseline Context ID is 23.

entry.name: >>View Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: View Modifier. Required if needed to fully specify the View. See Section C.8.4.11.1.8 for further explanation. Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

entry.name: Rotation Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe TOMO rotational groups. A new rotation is defined whenever the direction of the detector motion changes, or the Table Traverse (0018,1131) changes. The number of items shall be equal to Number of Rotations (0054,0051). If Rotation Vector (0054,0050) is present, the first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Rotation Vector (0054,0050), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Start Angle
entry.description: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of this rotation, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter- clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Angular Step
entry.description: The angular scan arc step between views of the TOMO acquisition, in degrees. See C.8.4.12.1.1 for further explanation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of rotation of the detector about the patient. See Start Angle (0054,0200) for further explanation of direction. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise (decreasing angle) CC = counter-clockwise (increasing angle). Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Scan Arc
entry.description: The effective angular range of the scan data in degrees. The value shall be positive. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Actual Frame Duration
entry.description: Nominal acquisition time per angular position, in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Radial Position
entry.description: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. It shall have a single value which is an average value for this rotation, or it shall have one value per angular view.

entry.name: >Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 4, is TRANSMISSION and a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Number of Frames in Rotation
entry.description: Number of angular views in this rotation. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >Table Traverse
entry.description: Location of the patient table (or gantry relative to the table) in mm.The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer.

entry.name: >Table Height
entry.description: The distance in mm of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation. Table height below the center of rotation has a positive value.

entry.name: Type of Detector Motion
entry.description: Describes the detector motion during acquisition. Enumerated Values: STEP AND SHOOT = Interrupted motion, acquire only while stationary. CONTINUOUS = Gantry motion and acquisition are simultaneous and continuous. ACQ DURING STEP = Interrupted motion, acquisition is continuous.

entry.name: Beat Rejection Flag
entry.description: Heart beat duration sorting has been applied. Enumerated Values: Y = yes N = no

entry.name: PVC Rejection
entry.description: Description of type of arrhythmic beat rejection criteria used.

entry.name: Skip Beats
entry.description: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia

entry.name: Heart Rate
entry.description: Average number of heart beats per minute for the collection period for these frames. This shall include all accepted beats as well as rejected beats.

entry.name: Gated Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe R-R intervals. Each gated interval is defined by an upper and lower range of heart beat durations. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060). The number of items shall be equal to Number of R-R Intervals (0054,0061). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >Trigger Time
entry.description: Time interval measured in msec from the start of the R-wave to the beginning of the data taking.

entry.name: >Framing Type
entry.description: Description of type of framing performed such as forward, backward, forward/backward by percentage.

entry.name: >Data Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe gating criteria. See C.8.4.13.1.1. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Frame Time
entry.description: Nominal time per individual frame in msec. Required if a sequence Item is present.

entry.name: >>Nominal Interval
entry.description: Average duration of accepted beats, in msec.

entry.name: >>Low R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval lower limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: >>High R-R Value
entry.description: R-R interval upper limit for beat rejection, in msec

entry.name: >>Intervals Acquired
entry.description: Number of heartbeats that fall within Low R-R Value (0018,1081) and High R-R Value (0018,1082), and were therefore accepted and contribute gamma events to this R-R Interval.

entry.name: >>Intervals Rejected
entry.description: Number of heartbeats that fall outside Low R-R (0018,1081) and High R-R Value (0018,1082), and do not contribute gamma events to this R-R Interval. However, they may contribute gamma events to other R-R Intervals.

entry.name: >>Time Slot Information Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Repeating Items that describe Time Slot Information. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070). The number of items shall be equal to Number of Time Slots (0054,0071). The first item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Time Slot Vector (0054,0070), the second item with value 2, etc.

entry.name: >>>Time Slot Time
entry.description: The total amount of time, in msec, that the acquisition accumulates gamma events into this frame. See C.8.4.13.1.2.
